items.title: *Sigue en español* ACTION ALERT - We share with you in anger...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

*Sigue en español*
ACTION ALERT - We share with you in anger and sadness the unjust news that Not1More member Hilda Martinez was arrested at a Border Patrol checkpoint on Friday and is being held in jail in New Mexico right now. Hilda Martinez requests your immediate solidarity. She was visiting family in El Paso last week. These checkpoints are a part of the daily terror and oppression Border Patrol inflicts on the region. She will have her first hearing this week. Her child...ren are safe here in Colorado as they did not accompany her on this visit.
Action steps:
1. Leave a love note or prayer here for Hilda. We'll be sharing them with her when she calls.
2. Attend our livestream vigil tonight. https://fb.me/e/42WwzHSmJ Next steps will be shared and we'll hear from her or her sister.
3. Contribute to this gofundme and share in solidarity to support her legal costs and her children. gf.me/u/zhqkph
4. Sign and share her petition https://www.change.org/p/united-state-attorney-free-hilda-b…
#FreeHilda #KeepFamiliesTogether
*********************************************
ALERTA de ACCION – Compartimos con rabia, tristeza y firmeza que una líder de Ni1Mas, Hilda Martinez, fue arrestada el viernes por parte de la Patrulla Fronteriza en un punto de reten y esta encarcelada en Nueva México en este momento. Hilda se solicita su solidaridad inmediata. . Ella estuvo visitando con familia en el área de El Paso, TX la semana pasada. Estos retenes son parte del terror y represión que se impone la Patrulla Fronteriza en las comunidades fronterizas. Tendrá su primera audiencia esta semana. Sus hijos están aquí al salvo en Colorado como no fueron con ella de paseo.
Paso de acción:
1. Deja una oración o nota de amor por Hilda Aquí. Vamos a estar compartiendo estos con ella.
2. Asiste a la vigilia virtual de esta noche https://fb.me/e/42WwzHSmJ
3. Contribuye a su gofundme por gastos legales y para el sosten de sus hijos gf.me/u/zhqkph
4 Firme y comparte su peticion. https://www.change.org/p/united-state-attorney-free-hilda-b…
Sanctuary4All Colorado Colorado Immigrant Rights Coalition - CIRC Colorado People's Alliance

See More

forbes.com

Regions Bank Of Alabama Turns Its Back On CoreCivic, Announces Plan To End Relationship

items.title: "After her daughter's birth, Angela and her family...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

"After her daughter's birth, Angela and her family were not allowed to stay in the U.S. Instead, they were expelled to Mexico without a court hearing under a pandemic-related measure authorized by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) last spring, according to lawyers.

Thousands of asylum-seekers waiting at America's doorstep face similar predicaments as a result of a network of policies the Trump administration implemented to deter would-be migrants, whom it a...ccused of gaming the country's humanitarian programs to gain easy entry into the U.S.

President Biden decried these measures as "inhumane" and vowed to end them during the campaign, accusing the Trump administration of forcing asylum applicants to live "in squalor." After winning the election, his advisers said unwinding the many policies would take time, largely due to the pandemic.

During Mr. Biden's first day in office, his administration stopped placing asylum-seekers in the so-called "Remain-in Mexico" program. He is also set to formally end the policy and other asylum limits this week as part of an executive order to retool how U.S. border officials will process migrants going forward.
But the new administration continues to use the Trump-era CDC order to quickly expel migrants — including families with children — without allowing them to request U.S. refuge, according to court documents and interviews with attorneys. The government has also not said whether it will allow the estimated 20,000 migrants in Mexico with pending asylum applications to continue their cases inside the U.S."

See MoreU.S. border agents continue to expel migrants, including families with children, without court hearings under a policy instituted by the Trump administration.

cbsnews.com

Biden retains Trump's border rules for now, with migrants stuck in Mexico or facing expulsion

U.S. border agents continue to expel migrants, including families with children, without court hearings under a policy instituted by the Trump administration.U.S. border agents continue to expel migrants, including families with children, without court hearings under a policy instituted by the Trump administration.

items.title: Sigue en espanol AFSC will be hosting another vigil in February...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

Sigue en espanol

AFSC will be hosting another vigil in February with the theme- Love Knows No Borders, No Walls

For the 12th year in a row, AFSC will deliver handmade valentines to detention center detainees and day laborers. People who could use extra love right now. We consider this a meditation. Make something beautiful for someone separated from loved ones, separated by borders and distance or by walls. We assert that our Love knows No Borders, No Walls.

...

Don’t miss the Virtual Vigil on Monday, February 1st, 6:00-7:00 pm right here or on our page.
*********************
AFSC llevará a cabo otra vigilia en febrero con el tema: El amor no conoce fronteras, sin muros.

Por 12 años consecutivo, AFSC entregará tarjetas de San Valentín hechas a mano a los detenidos y jornaleros del centro de detención. Personas que podrían usar amor extra ahora mismo. Consideramos esto como una meditación. Haga algo hermoso para alguien separado de sus seres queridos, separado por los bordes y la distancia o por las paredes. Afirmamos que nuestro amor no conoce fronteras, ni muros.

No se pierda la Vigilia Virtual el lunes 1 de febrero, de 6:00 a 7:00 p.m. Se presenta aqui en Facebook.

See More

MON, FEB 1

Love Knows No Borders, No Walls Virtual Vigil

Causes · 152 people

items.title: Tania is selling enchiladas on February 6th with the Solidarity...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

Tania is selling enchiladas on February 6th with the Solidarity Meals program. She arrived to the U.S. when she was just five years old, and through DACA she’s been able to pursue higher education, work for Denver Public Schools as a family liaison, and have a family of her own. She’s now applying for her residency, which is an incredibly expensive process, so she’s selling enchiladas this weekend to help raise money to cover the costs. You can order at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co. Pickup will be in Denver this weekend, and money can be sent via Venmo to @/tania-baez-30. Place in Denver for pick up 1400 N Lafayette St Denver Co 80218 ready 1 pm

items.title: Panel y discusión:  -----------------------  31 de enero de...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

Panel y discusión:
-----------------------

31 de enero de 2021, 10 a.m.-11: 30 a.m. PST / 1 p.m.-2: 30 p.m. EST

...

Los inmigrantes en los EE. UU. Se enfrentan a una realidad más dura que nunca bajo la pandemia de COVID-19. Todos los días, los trabajadores indocumentados y sus familias enfrentan no solo la amenaza constante de ICE y la violencia policial, sino también condiciones de trabajo cada vez más inseguras y de explotación, vivienda insegura, exclusión de los servicios básicos de salud y acceso casi imposible a los beneficios de lo que restos del estado de bienestar. ¡Únase a nosotros para discutir estas realidades y luchas de costa a costa!

Escucharemos a los panelistas involucrados en esta lucha de Pangea, Corriente Obrera, Cosecha, Workers 'Voice-La Voz de los Trabajadores y CST-México. Luego, tendremos tiempo para una discusión abierta.

*** El evento está en español con traducción al inglés.

**** Regístrese aquí: https://bit.ly/3nsqAjV
____________________________________________

La lucha por los derechos de los inmigrantes:
bajo el covid y la nueva administración Biden

Panel y discusión:
------------------

31 de enero de 2021. 10:00 am Hora del Pacifico

En Estados Unidos, los inmigrantes se enfrentan a realidades cada vez más duras bajo la pandemia de COVID-19. Día tras día, los trabajadores indocumentados y sus familias se enfrentan no sólo a la amenaza constante de la migra, la violencia policial y el encarcelamiento, sino también a peligrosas condiciones de trabajo, a la explotación, a la precariedad en la vivienda, la exclusión de los servicios médicos más básicos, y casi imposible acceso a los beneficios de lo poco que queda del estado de bienestar. ¡Venga a debatir estas realidades y nuestras luchas con nosotros!

*** Evento en español con traducción al inglés

**** Registrarse aqui: https://bit.ly/3nsqAjV

See More

SUN, JAN 31

The FIGHT for Immigrant Rights/ La lucha por los derechos de los inmigrantes

Online EventCauses · 123 people

items.title: "When Westword asked GEO Group about Biden's January...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

"When Westword asked GEO Group about Biden's January 26 executive order calling for the Department of Justice to phase out its use of private prisons, Pablo Paez, a vice president for the company, said that the order is a "solution in search of a problem" and that GEO Group has run "newer and more modern" facilities for the Bureau of Prisons for more than three decades.

Paez did not respond when asked whether GEO Group was concerned about a possible shift away from private prisons for immigrant detention; ICE declined to comment."

"Privately run facilities have failed to meet that standard."

westword.com

Crow Wants Biden to Stop Using Private Prisons for Immigrant Detention

"Privately run facilities have failed to meet that standard.""Privately run facilities have failed to meet that standard."

items.title: "Blanco, her husband, came to the U.S. in 2005 and lived...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Blanco, her husband, came to the U.S. in 2005 and lived and worked in the country without legal status until 2011, when a car crash put him on federal authorities’ radars. Ever since, he’s been fighting for a pathway to remain in the country and avoid deportation back to El Salvador.

It’s not uncommon for cases like his to take the better part of a decade. As people navigate the country’s complicated, constantly changing legal landscape, they’re usually granted permission to... work. Blanco was holding down a job at a restaurant until COVID-19 restrictions meant his hours whittled away to nothing. Though taxes from his wages paid into Colorado’s unemployment insurance system, his status meant he wasn’t allowed to benefit from that program. His family was also ineligible for the congressional stimulus checks issued last year.

The money he and Martinez make from the food they sell helps them feed their two children and stay engaged in Blanco’s case."

See MorePresident Biden's new direction on immigration is giving some hope as financial stability continues to drop beneath them.

denverite.com

Undocumented Denverites can't file for unemployment, so families got creative to keep the bills paid

President Biden's new direction on immigration is giving some hope as financial stability continues to drop beneath them.President Biden's new direction on immigration is giving some hope as financial stability continues to drop beneath them.

items.title: Today Joe Biden signed several executive orders. One was widely...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

Today Joe Biden signed several executive orders. One was widely hailed as “the end of private prisons.” I saw major media organizations and leading political leaders literally tweet that Biden just issued an executive order “ending private prisons.”⁣
⁣
Except NO SUCH THING happened. ⁣
⁣
The overwhelming majority of private prisons are state-based. 100% of those private prisons will continue. ⁣...
⁣
But not only will 100% of city, county, and state based private prisons continue to operate, the majority of federal private prisons and detention centers, which are immigration detention centers, will continue as well. Biden’s executive order didn’t cover any of those. ⁣
⁣
About 8% of all incarcerated people are housed in private prisons. Most of those people will remain in private prisons. ⁣
⁣
92% of all incarcerated people are in public facilities. Worse, Biden’s executive order appears to impact only a microscopic amount of the already tiny percentage of people held in private prisons. ⁣
⁣
One expert today told me that Biden’s announcement would impact such a tiny percentage of people that he didn’t actually have a number for it – because it’s less than half of a percent. And they are simply going to be moved to other prisons - not released. ⁣
⁣
This is performative change. It’s more than nothing, but at the same time somewhere in the ballpark of a half step above nothing. To actually confront this problem, it’s going to take a lot of more than this. ⁣
⁣
On the list of things that could be done, this doesn’t crack the top 25. It’s performative. Fluff. Nothing changes.

See More

items.title: This New Year’s Eve, please join the @denvercommunists and other activists across the Colorado Front Range who have...
items.content_html:
This New Year’s Eve, please join the @denvercommunists and other activists across the Colorado Front Range who have organized a noise demonstration in solidarity with our incarcerated neighbors and political prisoners like anarchist, activist, and poet, Eric King.

What better way is there to show solidarity other than showing up, making some noise & closing out this shit show of a year together? Show up with your best NYE noise makers, demonstration banners and signs. Who knows, we may even try out a new flavor of Pig face? Fed or Jeffco anyone?

We are planning on meeting up at Harriman Lake Park at 7:30 pm at W Quincy Ave & S. Kipling Pkwy, then heading to the facility which is across the street at 9595 W Quincy Ave Littleton, CO 80123.

**Neither we, nor the other organizers of this action, are affiliated in any way with Eric King nor the Eric King Support team @SupportEricKing. We all just want to show some love and and we are happy to signal boost that!**

“I have been incredibly fortunate to have so many people come into my life and take a stand with me so that I didn’t have to face this shit alone… From the smallest greeting to the big gestures, everything has meant so much to me… Now that said, I stand by my actions... After seeing what happened in Ferguson, so close down the road, I was disgusted by the lack of mobilization in my city. Three hours away people were fighting for their lives and we weren’t even taking to the streets. We were doing nothing. My act as a very personal display of my anger and rage toward the state as well as an act of solidarity to everyone in Ferguson. We never know our own strength until we are tested and even with my ridiculous sentence I feel at least proud to have been able to stand strong and refuse to cooperate with the state. I am just really happy that I don’t have to take this alone and have so many amazing people standing next to me. Until all are free.”
— Eric King

https://unicornriot.ninja/2016/eric-king-given-10-yr-sentence-throwing-molotovs-empty-govt-building/

items.title: Join us Friday, December 18 at 7 p.m. for a premiere virtual screening of “The Facility.” ...
items.content_html:
Join us Friday, December 18 at 7 p.m. for a premiere virtual screening of “The Facility.”

“The Facility” is a short documentary film chronicling the lived experiences of immigrants being held at the GEO detention facility in Aurora, Colorado. This film addresses the personal loss and consequences caused by for-profit detention and the federal government's broken immigration policies. Legal and medical experts highlight horrific abuses including death, medical neglect, nutrition issues, and prolonged detention during the coronavirus pandemic. To tell their stories, current and former detainees, families fighting to be reunited, and advocates come together to share their experiences behind the walls of the GEO immigration detention facility in Aurora.

@acluofcolorado @coloradopeoplesalliance @co_immigrant @keshagrijalva @_floodlight_

Following the screening will be a Q&A session with the director, legal experts, and individuals featured in the film with first-hand experience of the systemic abuse occurring inside the facility.

Panelists include:

Jeremy Flood, “The Facility” Director
Raul Medina Perez, COPA, Community Organizer who was formerly detained at GEO
Kesha Davalos Grijalva, Immigrant rights advocate whose husband is detained at GEO
Keinada Andereas, Colorado Student who was formerly detained at GEO
Hans Meyer, The Meyer Law Office, Lead Attorney
Denise Maes, ACLU of Colorado, Public Policy Director

Please RSVP for the screening in advance for this free event: https://aclu.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_nUbTy8-VQpif8nMzqtUzQw

Trailer: https://youtu.be/cGOCejy48Jo

“The Facility” is presented by ACLU of Colorado, Colorado Immigrant Rights Coalition, and Colorado Hispanic Bar Association.
